# Superstore Sales Analysis 

## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Sales Performance Analysis

**Q1: What is the total sales revenue generated by the company?**  
‚úÖ Total sales generated by the company: **$2,272,450.07**

**Q2: How have sales changed over time (monthly/annually)?**  
‚úÖ Monthly and yearly sales trends were analyzed to observe fluctuations.

**Q3: Which product category contributes the most to sales?**  
‚úÖ **Technology** contributes the most to sales.

---

## 2Ô∏è‚É£ Profitability Insights

**Q4: What is the total profit earned by the company?**  
‚úÖ Total profit generated: **$282,858.46**

**Q5: Which product category has the highest profit margin?**  
‚úÖ **Technology** category has the highest profit margin.

**Q6: Which region is the most profitable?**  
‚úÖ **West** region generated the most profit.

---

## 3Ô∏è‚É£ Customer Insights

**Q7: Who are the top 10 customers by total sales?**  
‚úÖ The top 10 customers were identified based on highest total purchase value.

**Q8: Which customer segment contributes the most to sales?**  
‚úÖ **Consumer** segment contributes the most to total sales.

**Q9: What is the average order value (AOV) for each segment?**  
‚úÖ AOV was calculated based on segment-wise purchases.

---

## 4Ô∏è‚É£ Shipping & Order Trends

**Q10: What are the most common shipping methods used?**  
‚úÖ **Standard Class** is the most frequently used shipping method.

**Q11: Which shipping mode is the fastest (based on average shipping time)?**  
‚úÖ **Same Day** shipping is the fastest method.

**Q12: Are there any delays in shipping?**  
‚úÖ There are **9,191 delayed orders** in the dataset.

---

## üîó Conclusion & Final Insights
- **Profitability Strategy:** Some product categories have **high sales but low profit margins**. Adjusting pricing and discounts can improve revenue.
- **Shipping Efficiency:** Prioritizing **faster shipping methods** can reduce delivery delays.
- **Customer Segmentation:** **High-value customers** should be targeted with **loyalty programs** to boost sales.
